    • Method Detail

      • comboCheck

        @Deprecated
public static boolean comboCheck(@NonNull
                                              java.lang.String tag,
                                              @NonNull
                                              java.lang.String methodName,
                                              @NonNull
                                              java.lang.Object[] objects,
                                              int[] integers)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecated. Checks at same time object array with variables and integer array with ints. The object array will be checked with the pass() method, see InitCheck.pass method. All integers in the int[] will be checked, whether they are positive or not. In case of incorrect variables, please check log with the Logcat.
        Parameters:
        tag - String - The name of the class caller .
        methodName - String - The name of the method caller.
        objects - Object[] - Array of objects which extend the Object, and will pass through a validation check.
        integers - int[] - Array with all the int variables that will be checked.
        Returns:
        boolean - Returns true if all the variables are valid, including the tag, methodName, and objects parameters, otherwise will returns false.
        Since:
        1.03

      • pass

        public static boolean pass(@NonNull
                           java.lang.String tag,
                           @NonNull
                           java.lang.String methodName,
                           java.lang.Object... objects)
        Checks the objects in the objects array, first of all, if they have valid pointer, and depending on the object type, if they are valid String, Collection, or Bundle.
        - A valid String will be each string, which has a pointer and the length is bigger than 0 (zero).
        - A valid Collection will be each collection, which has a pointer and the size is bigger than 0 (zero).
        - A valid Bundle will be each bundle, which has a pointer and it is not empty.
        Parameters:
        tag - String - The name of the class caller.
        methodName - String- The name of the method caller.
        objects - Object... - Array of objects which extend the Object, and will pass through a validation check.
        Returns:
        boolean - Returns true if all the variables are valid, including the tag, methodName, and objects parameters, otherwise will returns false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • checkInstance

        public static boolean checkInstance(@NonNull
                                    java.lang.String tag,
                                    @NonNull
                                    java.lang.String methodName,
                                    boolean isNull,
                                    java.lang.Object object)
        Check a single variable, whether it is a valid object, or not. First of all checks, if t does have a valid pointer, and depending on the object type, if it is a valid String, Collection, Bundle, or Integer.
        - A valid String will be each string, which has a pointer and the length is bigger than 0 (zero).
        - A valid Collection will be each collection, which has a pointer and the size is bigger than 0 (zero).
        - A valid Bundle will be each bundle, which has a pointer and it is not empty. - A valid Integer will be each Integer, which has a pointer, or primitive int, and in both cases has positive value.
        Parameters:
        tag - String - The name of the class caller.
        methodName - String - The name of the method caller.
        isNull - boolean- A default value, which will be returned in case the given variable as parameter is not valid.
        object - Object - The variable, which will pass through a validation check. The variable must extends the Object .
        Returns:
        boolean
        Since:
        1.03
